page.title: ChatSage Bot Commands
page.expandTip: Click any command row below to expand and see usage details.

ask.name: !ask / !sage
ask.description: Ask Sage a question. Uses search intelligently.

search.name: !search
search.description: Searches the web for information on a topic.

game.name: !game
game.description: Provides researched information about the game currently being played. Add "analyze" to use AI image recognition on the stream (uses Twitch thumbnail that updates every 5 minutes).

translate.name: !translate
translate.description: Manage automatic message translation for users.

help.name: !commands / !help
help.description: Shows where to find the list of available commands.

lurk.name: !lurk
lurk.description: Let the chat know you are lurking. Provide an optional reason for a custom send-off.

geo.name: !geo
geo.description: Starts or manages Geo-Game, a geography guessing game for IRL or virtual worlds.

usage.region: Starts a region-specific real-world game, e.g. !geo Japan
usage.game: Starts a game-world game using current stream's game
usage.gameTitle: Starts a game-world game with specified game, e.g. !geo game "Metroid Prime"
usage.rounds: Runs any game command with N rounds, e.g. !geo Japan 3
usage.stop: Game initiator, mods, or broadcaster can stop
usage.interval: Sets time between clues to 30-300 seconds
usage.configRegion: Sets regions like Europe,Asia or USA,Canada

riddle.name: !riddle
riddle.description: Starts or manages a Riddle game. Riddles can be general, about the current stream game, or a specific subject.

usage.subject: Example: !riddle animals
usage.game: Riddle about the current stream game
usage.stop: Game initiator, mods, or broadcaster can stop
usage.questionTime: Sets time per riddle to 15-120 seconds
usage.keywordsLimit: Sets recent keywords to exclude, e.g. 20-100

trivia.name: !trivia
trivia.description: Starts or manages Trivia games with factual questions on various topics, including the current stream game.

usage.game: Starts trivia about the current stream game
usage.stop: Game initiator, mods, or broadcaster can stop
usage.time: Sets time per question to 10-120 seconds

botlang.name: !botlang
botlang.description: Configure the bot to speak in a specific language for the entire channel.

usage.status: Shows current auto-chat mode, frequency, and categories
usage.freq: Sets minimum gap between auto messages (minutes)

disable.name: !disable
disable.description: Disables a command in this channel.

enable.name: !enable
enable.description: Enables a previously disabled command in this channel.

ping.name: !ping
ping.description: Checks if the bot is responsive. Responds with Pong!

page.expandTip: Click any command row below to expand and see usage details.

categories.channelPoints: Channel Points â†’ TTS (Web Dashboard Only)

intro.tipPrefix: All TTS commands are prefixed with !tts.
intro.expandTip: Click any command row below to expand and see usage details.
intro.dashboardInfo: Broadcasters and viewers can also configure settings using the ChatVibes Web Dashboard.
intro.preferencesInfo: Viewers can set their own TTS preferences using the web UI by sending !myvoice in chat.

commandsSummary.status: Gets the current status of the TTS application for the channel.
commandsSummary.voices: Provides a link to the documentation section for available TTS voices.
commandsSummary.prefs: Sends you a short-lived link to your personal TTS settings page.
commandsSummary.on: Enables the TTS engine. Messages and events may be spoken based on the current mode.
commandsSummary.off: Disables the TTS engine entirely. No messages or events will be spoken.
commandsSummary.permission: Sets a filter on who can trigger TTS when the bot is in all mode.
commandsSummary.bits: Configures the Bits-for-TTS feature, allowing channels to require a minimum Cheer amount to trigger TTS.
commandsSummary.pause: Pauses the processing of the TTS event queue.
commandsSummary.resume: Resumes processing of the TTS event queue if it was paused.
commandsSummary.clear: Clears all pending messages and events from the TTS queue.
commandsSummary.stop: Stops the currently playing or generating TTS audio.
commandsSummary.voice: Allows a user to set their preferred voice for messages they send.
commandsSummary.emotion: Allows a user to set their preferred emotion for their messages.
commandsSummary.language: Sets your preferred language boost for TTS.
commandsSummary.ignore: Add yourself to the TTS ignore list for the channel.

troubleshooting.botNotResponding: Bot not responding to commands? Make sure the bot is a moderator in your channel. You can do this by typing /mod chatvibesbot in your Twitch chat. In many cases, the bot may need moderator permissions to read messages and respond to commands.
troubleshooting.botNotSpeaking: Bot not speaking? Make sure the bot is enabled in your channel. You can do this by typing !tts on in your Twitch chat. Also, check the current mode !tts mode and permissions !tts permission.
troubleshooting.languageIssue: Bot not speaking in a specific language, or reading numbers in Chinese? Make sure the language boost is set to the correct language. You can do this by typing !tts language <language_name> for yourself or !tts defaultlanguage <language_name> for the channel in your Twitch chat. You can check the current language boost using !tts defaultlanguage.
troubleshooting.generationTooSlow: TTS generation taking too long or failing? ChatVibes now uses Wavespeed AI with sync mode enabled for the lowest latency. If you experience delays, check your internet connection and try using !tts stop to cancel any stuck generation. The bot automatically retries failed requests.
troubleshooting.voiceNotFound: Voice not found error? Make sure you're using the correct voice ID from the Voices section. Voice IDs are case-sensitive and must match exactly. Try !tts voices to get a link to available voices.
troubleshooting.voiceAccessDenied: Voice access denied error? Some voices (particularly certain Moss audio effects) may require special access permissions on Wavespeed AI. If you receive this error, try using a different voice from the available voices list. Most voices work with standard access.
troubleshooting.invalidVoice: Invalid voice error? The voice ID you're using is not available or doesn't exist. Make sure you're using the correct voice ID from the Voices section. Voice IDs are case-sensitive and must match exactly.
troubleshooting.emotionNotWorking: Emotion not working? Note that "auto" emotion is no longer supported. Use neutral, happy, sad, angry, fearful, disgusted, or surprised instead.
troubleshooting.needHelp: Need help? Contact the developer via the contact form at Henry's portfolio website.
